definition: Kawabata Yasunari, Japanese literature Nobel laureate
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
river/creek/plain/an area of level country
old variant of 端[duan1]/start/origin
end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular
surname Kang
healthy/peaceful/abundant
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: The Snow World wrote by Kawabata Yasunari is a famous masterpiece with unvarying artistic fascination.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成的《雪国》是一部具有恒久艺术魅力的名作。

sentences.english: Kawabata is one of the pioneers of modernism in Japanese literature.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成是日本文学现代派的开山祖师之一。

sentences.english: Kawabata had been engaged in the translation of Tangs Fictions into modern Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成曾从事唐人小说的现代日语翻译。

sentences.english: Kawakawa Yasunari makes no exception either.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成的创作也不例外。

sentences.english: Lzunoodoriko is the masterpiece of the famous Japanese writer Kawabata Yasunari.
sentences.chinese: 《伊豆舞女》是日本著名作家川端康成的代表作之一。

sentences.english: The reason is Yasunari Kawabata literary theory is a complex multidimensional.
sentences.chinese: 究其原因则是川端康成文艺思想是复杂多维的。

sentences.english: Yasunari Kawabata kept a close relationship with art in his whole life.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成一生与美术结下不解之缘。
